posts.post_content:
To trade, some lower grade t206 commons
All backs are Sweet Corporal or Piedmont (nothing interesting)

Doc White Chicago throwing, very good condition, not much corner wear, no ink or creases
Gabby Street Washington fielding, very good condition, not much corner wear, no ink or creases
Charlie Starr Boston fielding, a 8 mm tear, but otherwise is very good condition, not much corner wear, no ink or creases
Paul Davidson Indianapolis portrait, good, a couple of partial creases on the front
Jean Dubuc, Cincinnati ready to throw, fair one ink line on back, rounded corners, sliver a paper loss on edge
Hooks Wiltse, New York, portrait with cap, good, multiple partial creases
Simon Nicholls Philadelphia fielding, fair multiple small creases on surface and rounded corners
Doc White Chicago throwing, fair small water spot on front, rounded corners
Lee Quillen Minneapolis portrait, fair multiple small creases on surface and rounded corners
Dave Brain Buffalo portrait, poor creases on surface, significant corner wear, small tear right upper edge
Terry Turner Cleveland portrait, poor ink all over the back with small area of paper loss, ink bleeds through slightly to front
Red Kleinow New York batting, very poor a hole in the center, heavy corner wear and paper loss on the front

In return I am looking for Caramel cards, t205s.  I have about 460 t206s, so I am not looking for many of these.

Scans available
e-mail if interested at [url]manary@kids.wustl.edu[/url]

Mark Manary
